SP-L: Thoroughbreds (Mocchi, Tiger, Arrowhead)
Monster Rancher Metropolis: Monster Rancher Advance 2 Archive (GameBoy Advance): The Shrine (Passwords and Unlocking): Special Breeds and Legendary Breeds: SP-L: Thoroughbreds (Mocchi, Tiger, Arrowhead)
By GoldenBoy on Tuesday, January 21, 2003 - 05:08 pm:

Thorr and I have muddled through a lot of raising and combining and we have a method for unlocking 3 more Legend Types (Arrowhead, Mocchi, Tiger)*. Hereafter referred to as the Thoroughbred Legends.

First let's define what exactly is a Thoroughbred monster. A Thoroughbred monster is a monster with a COMPLETE family tree consisting of monsters of the same Breed**. Depending on what you are trying to do, all these ancestors must be of a certain rank or above. For example the Tigers to make whitehound need to be rank A or above.

*You can get these Legends prior to beating Emperor's Cup as long as you have all the breeds you need unlocked (Zan, Joker, Gali, depending on which you work on)
**it is not yet known if normal variants work, but pures and specials do

PART 1
The harder Thoroughbred process opens Whitehound, and Serket. The process is long (table1), but if you have an MRA2 buddy its a lot easier (table2). Together its 3 monsters apiece as opposed to 7 alone (per legend type). You must create a complete, developed bloodine. Three generations raised to Class A on both sides of the family. Yes, it's crazy, but it works.
1) Raise a pair of [MONSTER] to Class A
2) Combine
3) Repeat 1 and 2
4) Raise those children to Class A
5) Combine
6) This child is a thoroughbred, and when combined will produce a Legend (see table 3 to learn which need to be raised)
7) Combine with [MIXER] (raising both the Thoroughbred and the Mixer is a good idea, it makes for a really good Book monster)

MONSTER- The breed of the legend you are opening (table3)
MIXER- The rank required varies (see table3)

It's confirmed the monsters can be pure, or special (Unknown if regular main/subs work). We ended up completing this via a method halfway between the two diagrammed since it was only convenient to meet to link once. We know mixing and matching pure/special will work.

Table1- solo___Table2- partners
Monster1Monster4Monster1Monster2
Gen1+Monster2+Monster5+Monster2Link+Monster1
Monster3Monster6Monster3Monster4
Monster3Monster3Monster4
Gen2+Monster6+Monster4Link+Monster3
Th.bred7Th.bred5Th.bred6
MixerMixer1Mixer2
Gen3+Th.bred7+Th.bred5+Th.bred6
Gen4LegendLegend1Legend2


Table3
ThoroughbredMixer(rank)Legend
ArrowheadJoker(B)Serket
TigerGali(E)Whitehound


PART 2
The Mocchi method is simpler. It requires developing TWO Thoroughbreds, but Class E monsters work:
1) Create a Thoroughbred Mocchi (follow table 1 or 2 until 3rd generation)
2) Create a Thoroughbred Zan (follow table 1 or 2 until 3rd generation)
3) Combine Mocchi and Zan to open Devi


NOTES
-We saw this idea initially on a Japanese bulletin board then did some translating to work out the kinks.

-We tested the theory using a gameshark. Then we proceeded to do it legitimately on our games.

-Neat fact: the Japanese think Class S is needed but the Gameshark test showed us Class A is as far as you have to go.

-We also tested not raising some or all of the generations, and it doesn't work out. Sorry gang you gotta raise a LOT of monsters to do things this way. Good luck!

-Thanks to HyleanKnight86 for confirming pre Emperor availability

By GoldenBoy on Wednesday, January 22, 2003 - 09:18 am:

OK Arrowhead problems solved and post edited to reflect the requirements.

Like I said above, its a great idea to raise those final kids and the Mixer monster to make a really nice Legend for your book. 3rd gen monsters raise amazingly easy.

Also there is some evidence that raising those monsters will help you get the 2 missing ones (Ifrit, and Scorpion). We'll post specifics when we know.
